intro: Phyllanthus seyrigii, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and waxy, green leaves. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or savanna habitats. Phyllanthus seyrigii is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage.
